segments.text: I notice the boy climbing onto that wobbly stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s stretching so far, and the stool looks like it’s about to collapse under him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe he’s doing this while his mother is right there, completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, not even noticing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re both going to end up on the wet floor if they’re not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring out of the sink, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy even realizes how close he is to falling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole situation is just asking for trouble, and I feel like I should do something about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But maybe they’ll be fine, and I’m just overreacting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone stops them before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
